searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: QuickBounds is a spatial detection module to track BaseParts moving in and out of predefined areas in the world. It uses a Bounding Volume Hierarchy under the hood to minimize the costs of tracking these BaseParts.

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: If you use wally, then put this in your wally.toml  QuickBounds = "unityjaeger/quickbounds@0.3.0"   Alternatively, if you use pesde, then you can install it like this:  pesde add unityjaeger/quickbounds   Or if you want the source, then just grab it from the latest release from the Releases tab.

searchDocs.title: Quick Start​
searchDocs.content: --create a group (optionally with a priority) local group = QuickBounds.createGroup(10) --lower priority groups get prioritized --create a zone local zone = QuickBounds.createZoneFromInstance(workspace.MyZonePart) --make the zone start watching specific groups zone:watchGroups(group) -- group:onEntered(function(_, zone, player) print(player.Name .. " entered the zone!") end) group:onExited(function(_, zone, player) print(player.Name .. " exited the zone!") end)

searchDocs.title: createZone​
searchDocs.content: </> QuickBounds.createZone( cframe: CFrame , size: Size, shape: "Block" | "Ball" | "Cylinder" | "Wedge" ) → Zone

searchDocs.title: createZoneFromInstance​
searchDocs.content: </> QuickBounds.createZoneFromInstance(part: BasePart ) → Zone Creates and returns a Zone built from an instance, does not support Corner Wedges.

searchDocs.title: setFrameBudget​
searchDocs.content: </> QuickBounds.setFrameBudget(budget: number) → () Sets the frame budget available for each processing frame, in seconds.

searchDocs.title: createGroup​
searchDocs.content: </> QuickBounds.createGroup(priority: number?) → Group Creates and returns a group, with an optionally specified priority. Default priority is 1e6 (100'000).

searchDocs.title: UID​
searchDocs.content: </> Group.UID: number Unique identifier for this group.

searchDocs.title: add​
searchDocs.content: </> Group:add( part: BasePart , customData: any? ) → () Start tracking the specified BasePart.

searchDocs.title: remove​
searchDocs.content: </> Group:remove(part: BasePart ) → () Makes the group stop tracking the specified BasePart.

searchDocs.title: setPriority​
searchDocs.content: </> Group:setPriority(priority: number) → () Groups with the same priority can be entered by a part that is a member of both groups simultaneously. If the groups have a different priority then the one with a lower priority will win.

searchDocs.title: onEntered​
searchDocs.content: </> Group:onEntered(callback: ( part: BasePart , zone: Zone, customData: any? ) → ()) → () → () Tracks whenever a BasePart that is part of this group enters this group through a Zone with the use of a callback function, returns a cleanup function.

searchDocs.title: onExited​
searchDocs.content: </> Group:onExited(callback: ( part: BasePart , zone: Zone, customData: any? ) → ()) → () → () Tracks whenever a BasePart that is part of this group exits this group through a Zone with the use of a callback function, returns a cleanup function.

searchDocs.title: part​
searchDocs.content: </> Zone.part: BaseClass? If available, the part associated with the zone object.

searchDocs.title: index​
searchDocs.content: </> Zone.index: number Used for internal data structures.

searchDocs.title: watchGroups​
searchDocs.content: </> Zone:watchGroups(...: ...Group) → () Start watching the specified groups.

searchDocs.title: unwatchGroups​
searchDocs.content: </> Zone:unwatchGroups(...: ...Group) → () Stop watching the specified groups.
